channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Dem Rep. Calls Out Inflammatory Rhetoric Bandied About by His Own Party—'These Are Dangerous Lies'
Trump breaks silence on assassination attempt: 'I'm not supposed to be here'
item.description: Former President Trump speaks out for the first time since the shooting on Saturday at his rally in Butler, Pennsylvania.

item.title: Trump Rewrites Convention Speech to Focus on Unity
item.description: Former President Donald Trump has tossed his original speech for the Republican National Convention and rewritten it to focus on unity following the attempt on his life Saturday.

item.title: Disturbing Questions Emerge: Secret Service Knew Rooftop Was a Vulnerability—Why Wasn't It Protected?
Republican convention gets underway two days after Trump survived an assassination attempt
item.description: The Republican National Convention kicks off on Monday, just two days after former President Donald Trump, the GOP's standard-bearer, survived an assassination attempt.

item.title: 3 Months Ago, Man Prophesied Trump Assassination Attempt
item.description: The attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump apparently was seen in a vision months beforehand, the Gateway Pundit reported.

item.title: Insane New Video Shows Trump Shooter Moving on Roof, People Pointing Him Out Before Shooting
Biden's Cabinet condemns attempted assassination of former President Trump
item.description: Amid heightened election season rhetoric, Biden and White House Cabinet condemn violence post former President Donald Trump's assassination attempt.

item.title: Sen. Coons: See Each Other as Opponents, Not Enemies
item.description: Americans from different parties must see themselves as political opponents and not enemies, Sen. Chris Coons, D-Del., told NBC's "Meet the Press" on Sunday after Saturday's assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump.

item.title: Retired Army General: 'Somebody Failed to Appreciate the Militarily Significant Aspects of Terrain'
Trump survives shooting, but the politically charged blame game never fades
item.description: Former President Trump may have survived the Saturday evening attempt on his life, but the rhetorical blame game is virtually certain to rear its ugly head in the event's wake.

item.title: Vatican: Assassination Attempt 'Wounds People and Democracy'
item.description: The Vatican said Sunday that the assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump "wounds people and democracy, causing suffering and death."

item.title: Roseanne Barr and Others Dunk All Over Eric Swalwell for His Disgusting Post About Trump Shooter
Biden says politics must never be 'a literal battlefield' or 'killing field' in post-Trump shooting address
item.description: President Biden addressed the nation from the Oval Office Sunday night, saying the attempted assassination of former President Trump forces Americans to "take a step back" and "lower the temperature in our politics."

item.title: Ronald Kessler to Newsmax: Multiple Problems Within Secret Service
item.description: In the wake of the attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump, Ronald Kessler said there are a number of problems within the Secret Service, but the overarching issue is the attitude within the agency about operating on a shoestring budget.
